intro: Calandrinia menziesii var. macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Portulacaceae family, characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces vibrant pink to red flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, wind-dispersed seeds. This species is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
